About the role:
As the Senior Executive, Corporate Strategy, you will play a central role across the group in shaping, formalising, and advancing the initiatives, insights, and partnerships that strengthen our position in both the Australian and global markets. Beyond traditional strategy delivery, this role is responsible for building the structure, processes, and discipline required for a high‑impact strategy function; ensuring the organisation can scale, accelerate growth, and remove barriers to execution.

Other responsibilities include:

Drive the development and delivery of corporate strategies to grow market share, expand into new markets, and unlock future opportunities.
Identify and execute growth initiatives across corporate development, partnerships, strategic alliances, and potential M&A.
Lead organisation‑wide strategic initiatives, collaborating with senior leaders, operational teams, and external stakeholders.
Shape data and AI‑driven insights, assess strategic risks, and establish KPIs for reporting to executives and the Board.
Design and embed formal strategy processes, governance frameworks, and operating rhythms across the business.
Provide leadership to cross‑functional teams, scale the strategy function, and translate strategy into commercial outcomes through strong financial and market analysis.

What’s in it for you:

Professionally, you will be working in a high performing environment where decisions are rigorous and timely. You will engage across the entire business to help accelerate growth opportunities and interact with leaders and experts that are very committed to organisational success. Most importantly, this is a role where you can really make your mark and see the tangible results of your actions and contributions.

 

Personally, in addition to competitive remuneration, CDC offers excellent employment conditions and benefits such as:

CDC Academy -Make your mark by enhancing your professional development with the CDC Academy. Enrol in specialised training courses that will help you develop skills and ensure you thrive in your chosen career.
CDC Day - An additional day of paid leave dedicated to nurturing your health and wellbeing.
Parental Leave - Inclusive and above legislative tenure of parental leave entitlements to help you start, grow and care for your family.
Volunteer Leave - Make a meaningful difference with 2 days of volunteering leave for any cause or charity of your choice.
Employment Assistance Program - Be confident that you and your family are supported with access to our comprehensive Employee Assistance Program.

 This role is suited to a senior candidate with proven experience leading strategy, corporate development, or transformation at scale within a complex, high‑growth business, where they have owned outcomes and delivered tangible results.

Strong understanding of Australian and international markets, including regulatory, investment and competitive landscapes, with the ability to leverage these for strategic advantage.

Based within Miele Australia’s Finance team, this role sits at the heart of commercial decision-making for the New Zealand and Professional divisions. This is a highly visible role with real influence across the organisation and strong exposure to regional and global stakeholders.

Your Responsibilities

As Senior Financial Analyst, you will be responsible for delivering high-quality analysis, reporting and insights that support strategic and operational decisions. Key responsibilities include:

Financial analysis & insights
Deliver proactive, forward-looking analysis and actionable recommendations to support strategic decision-making across the New Zealand and Professional businesses.

Profitability & scenario modelling
Develop detailed gross margin analysis by customer, channel and product, and model financial scenarios for NPIs, promotions and commission structures, comparing “do nothing” versus proposed actions.

Budgeting & forecasting

Reporting & data management
Produce insightful financial reports, validate data integrity within Cognos and data warehouses, develop and maintain standard reports and dashboards (including the Professional monthly dashboard), and partner with the business to meet reporting needs.

Month-end close
Perform month-end activities for New Zealand and Professional, including posting journals, running profit and cost centre reports, investigating variances and ensuring accurate financial results.

Advanced analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to interpret complex data, identify trends and deliver clear, actionable insights.

Strong business partnering and communication skills, with proven ability to collaborate across functions and influence outcomes through sound commercial advice.

High level of technical capability in financial systems and tools, including Cognos, SAP, BI tools (e.g. Power BI) and advanced Excel skills for modelling and reporting.

Nice-to-have

Experience working with data warehouses and multiple reporting tools.

Exposure to international or matrix-style organisations.

A continuous improvement mindset with experience driving process or system enhancements.

Access to wellbeing programs, including annual flu vaccinations, Employee Assistance Program and holistic support
